intro: Chenopodiopsis retrorsa, commonly known as the reverseleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is typically found growing in rocky soils or along dry streambeds. Chenopodiopsis retrorsa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species in its native habitat.
